Relevant Courses: AP Computer Science A, AP Computer Science Principles, AP Calculus BC, AP Physics Mechanics

description: Currently developing a distributed weather simulation under a government sponsored research contract

Migrated Yun Zhangs GTasb3D paper and thermodynamics framework from shared memory OpenMP parallelism to fully distributed MPI using p4est, enabling multi node execution with coordinated inter process communication.

Developed three distributed orbital dynamics simulations using C with p4est for scalable spatial domain decomposition and parallelization across multi node compute environments such as Michigan’s SLURM computing resource
Used CMake and the Project Chrono Library to develop a build system the simulation could be compiled with​
Wrote the simulation code for the low-gravity environment, using the DEME demos from the SPEL team as a basis for design
Integrated CAD models from our mechanical team to perform iterative testing to optimize our results from the data collection
Utilized Python post-process numerical data and created visualizations for a 3D simulation-representation, using both PyVista and Paraview
Worked with API's request handling and data exchange, gaining experience in designing and interacting with web services and external systems
Explored server-side rendering and dynamic routing in Next.js to enhance web application performance
Participated in asynchronous mock interviews, completing Python DSA questions and receiving feedback to refine my problem-solving skills
Developed strong communication and interpersonal skills, growing my clientele and reputation
Gained experience in multitasking and problem-solving under pressure, ensuring a smooth operations for several tables at a time
Received countless positive online reviews and seating requests from customers
